column5: Oh man Glen...the broken rod just sucks!  Can you imagine the size of fish that had to be on to break that rod?  Jeez...just thinking about it....oh wait...sorry Glen.....  Blurry pics suck, but at least now I can sympathize with you!!  Good to see you getting out there on shore!

Nice catch, and ouch on the rod and blurry picture...  It seems whenever you catch something you really want to show off that happens...  Your smile says it all though...  Thanks for sharing  Cheers,  Jen  Those birds are amazing...
Great report G.  Sorry about the rod, but they'll replace it and then you'll have a shiny brand new one  Cool bird nest pics.  Joey
What the heck is all that green stuff all over the ground????? Nice pics! HH
thanks for the report, sorry about the broken rod.

Thanks for the report and super pics Bud. What's that structure next to your right elbow in the first two spot pics? Water looks pretty clean too. Too bad about the Crucial but it'll surely be replaced.
Stop teasing with these pic's blue skies, short sleeves ahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh   Still great report, wow broken rod must have been a super fish.  Thanks for the report
great report and some cool pics,too bad about the rod.
Been there done that!  O.k. I haven't been "there" but I've done that and will do it again.  Might even change my name to SNAP  s.

Glen, sorry to hear about the rod.  The picture......it may be blurry but at least one can see the fish in it!!  Thanks for posting the scenery shots.  The bird nests were interesting, don't recall ever seeing nests like that and who doesn't like flowers?
It must be nice to be able to fish for bass at this time of year!
~~~What you broke a rod, heck be like us just get a roll of the Handie-Man Friend and tape it up, it'll be as new, and I hope that sun burn hurts

At least it broke on a fish and wasn't run over or caught in a door or anything like that.  At least she gave it up for a good cause I say and now we get to learn how well the Shimano warranty works I guess.
What's a nu-nu?  Looks so pretty where you are....sigh*  Nice fish, nice pics...bet ya Ole Yeller wasn't too happy about your rod...hope she yelled really loud at ya.  lol  Thanks for sharing.
Them there Crucials just don't stand up!. Mine wouldn't even take a slow moving ceiling fan.    Fortunately it was only a couple inches off the end. It still works great. I really like the rod.
Looks like you had a good day out till you broke your rod nice pictures i like the ones with the birds  Rob
Tough break on that rod - no pun intended.  I've been there a few times....
Sorry to read about the broken rod but sure do appreciate the warm weather report. I am experiencing cabin fever something fierce and it's reports like yours that are keeping me going...  Mike
